dnn package¶

Submodules¶

dnn.activation module¶

dnn.activation.leaky_relu(features, alpha=0.01)¶

Leaky RELU - Prevents dying neurons due to gradient explosion

Parameters:
  • features – The input to the RELU layer
  • alpha – The slope of the negative input values
Returns:

relu activation output
dnn.activation.relu(features)¶

RELU activations

Parameters:features – The input to the RELU layer
Returns:relu activation output

dnn.layers module¶

class dnn.layers.Layers¶

Bases: object

add_activation_layer(input_layer_id, layer_name, activation_type='relu')¶

Adds the activation layer

Parameters:
  • input_layer_id – The input layer identifier
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
  • activation_type – ‘relu’ for RELU and ‘leaky-relu’ for Leaky RELU. Default = RELU
Returns:

None
add_ground_truth_layer(width, layer_name='ground_truth')¶

Adds ground truth layer to the model

Parameters:
  • width – The width of the ground truth = dimension of the input
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
Returns:

None
add_hidden_layer(input_layer_id, input_width, output_width, layer_name, batch_norm=False, sharing=False)¶

Adds the hidden layer to the model

Parameters:
  • input_layer_id – The input layer identifier
  • input_width – The width of the input for this layer
  • output_width – The width of the output for this layer
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
  • batch_norm – True -> if next layer is a batch normalization layer, else False. Default= False
  • sharing – True, if the layer is shared, else False.. Default=False
Returns:

None
add_input_layer(width, layer_name='input')¶

Adds input layer to the model

Parameters:
  • width – The width of the input = dimension of the input
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
Returns:

None
add_loss_layer(layer_name, prediction_layer_id, ground_truth_layer_id, loss_type)¶

Adds a layer corresponding to the loss function

Parameters:
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
  • prediction_layer_id – The identifier for the prediction layer
  • ground_truth_layer_id – The identifier for the ground truth layer
  • loss_type – The loss function to use. Available options defined by LossTypes.
Returns:

None
add_output_layer(input_layer_id, input_width, output_width, layer_name='output')¶

Adds the output layer to the model

Parameters:
  • input_layer_id – The input layer identifier
  • input_width – The width of the input for this layer
  • output_width – The width of the output for this layer
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
Returns:

None
add_regularization_layer(input_layer_id, layer_name, regularization_type='dropout', epsilon=None, dropout_ratio=None)¶

Adds the regularization layer to the model

Parameters:
  • input_layer_id – The input layer identifier
  • layer_name – The name of the layer. Type=string
  • regularization_type – ‘dropout’ for Dropout and ‘batch_norm’ for Batch Normalization. Default = ‘dropout’
  • epsilon – The batch_norm parameter to ensure that division is not by zero when variance of batch = 0
  • dropout_ratio – The fraction of the layers to be masked.
Returns:

None
get_layer(layer_id)¶

Retuns the tensorflow object corresponding to the requested layer

Parameters:layer_id – Layer identifier
Returns:Tensorflow layer object

network_type(is_first)¶

dnn.loss module¶

dnn.loss.cross_entropy(ground_truth, output)¶

Returns the Cross-Entropy loss container

Parameters:
  • ground_truth – The ground truth layer
  • output – The network output layer
Returns:

Cross-entropy error
dnn.loss.mse(ground_truth, output)¶

Returns the Mean Squared Error loss container

Parameters:
  • ground_truth – The ground truth layer
  • output – The network output layer
Returns:

MSE error

dnn.parameters module¶

dnn.parameters.bias_variable(shape, scope=None)¶

This creates the bias placeholder for the DNN layers

Parameters:
  • shape – shape of the bias variable
  • scope – scope of the bias variable
Returns:

The tensorflow placeholder for the bias
dnn.parameters.weight_variable(shape, scope=None)¶

This creates the weight placeholder for the DNN layers

Parameters:
  • shape – shape of the weight variable
  • scope – scope of the weight variable
Returns:

The tensorflow placeholder for weights

dnn.regularization module¶

dnn.regularization.batch_norm_layer(input_layer, epsilon=1e-05)¶

The batch normalization applied to the output of the layer before applying the activation.

* Note - If applying this layer, make sure that previous hidden layer has batch_norm flag = True *

Parameters:
  • input_layer – The input of the present layer, and the output of the previous layer
  • epsilon – The small value added to the denominator to prevent division by 0, when the variance = 0
Returns:

The batch normalization output. This output should be applied with the activation
dnn.regularization.dropout_layer(input_layer, dropout_ratio=0.5)¶

Forms a dropout layer

Parameters:
  • input_layer – The layer on which the dropout is to be applied
  • dropout_ratio – The ratio of the dropout that is to be applied
Returns:

The dropout layer
